bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Maria Teresa Rojas, October 4, 1952

div1.p: Hench expresses his concerns about the naming of the Camp Lazear memorial and the renovation of Building No. 1. He notes that the date of the dedication has been changed. Hench asks Rojas to review the material he sent and offers her advice. He provides family news.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Maria Teresa Rojas, October 4, 1952
div1.opener:
October 4, 1952
Senora Maria Teresa Rojas
Hotel Meurice
Rue de Rivoli
Paris, France
My dear Tina:
div1.p:
I have your letter of September 18. I have sent you two or three rather
long communications in Havana during the last several weeks and, not
having heard from you, assumed that you must be away, possibly in Europe.
No, I never did get your letter from Vienna and am very sorry not to
have it.

I am somewhat concerned about the present plans for the preservation of
Camp Lazear. I am not at all sure that they are going to call it Camp
Lazear. I still suspect they will call it Parque Finlay although Doctor
Nogueira tells me otherwise. They had planned to dedicate it the end of
September but now have changed the date to December 3, the date of
Finlay's birth. Also, they are repairing the little building and I do
hope they won't rip out so much of the original wood as to make what is
left simply a replica. I assume that the mail that I sent to you is
still at your home in Havana, and I shall be anxious to have your reactions
to the detailed information I have sent to you. Just last week I heard
from Doctor Nogueira about the December 3 date. I have sent him the names
of certain people that should be invited but in view of the uncertainties,
I imagine they have not invited anyone yet. I hate very much to bother
you as when you get home you will be tired and want to rest, but if you
could go over the material I sent fairly soon, I would be very grateful
for your suggestions and advice.

No, I do not expect to be in New York the middle of November. Mrs. Hench
and I will be in Boston on October 29 but I must come right back. She is
fine and we have just sent the kids off to college again. Kahler is in
his second year at Yale Medical School. Susan, having spent the summer
in Europe, is now back at Wellesley, a sophomore. Little John keeps us
company. I wish we could drop in and visit you for a few hours at the
Hotel Meurice. Mary will never forget her time with you there and we also
had the family there on our way to Stockholm. I imagine that Lydia is
with you. We send our very best wishes to you both.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
